text:
Q: How do you delete a node from a binary search tree?
A: you cannot delete a node because that can cause a node to have more than 2 children

Q: When defining a recursive function, what are possible causes for infinite recursion?
A: no base case no change in values.

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: The scope of global variables are created by placing variable declarations outside any class or function definition.  Global variables retain their values throughout the execution of the program and they can be referenced by any function that follows their declarations or definitions in the source file.

Q: How are arrays passed to functions?
A: You pass the name of the array to the function. So for: int bin [10]; you pass it to an array like so: jingle(bin); but jingle must be declared correctly in order to receive an array, either with prototype void jingle (int []); or with the definition in its initialization: void jingle (int array[]);  It's also worth noting that arrays are passed to function by reference, so as to not copy large arrays over and over and burn memory.  This gives the function complete control over the array however.

Q: When does C++ create a default constructor?
A: If a class does not explicitly include a constructor, the compiler creates one.

Q: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?
A: They have the same name, just different parameters.

Q: What does a function signature include?
A: The portion of a function prototype that includes the name of the function and the types of its arguments

Q: What is the main disadvantage of a doubly-linked list over a basic linked list?
A: increased actions to add and remove elements to the linked list.

Q: When defining a recursive function, what are possible causes for infinite recursion?
A: There is no base case. The recursion step doesn't reduce the problem during each recursive call.

Q: What is the role of a prototype program in problem solving?
A: To address major issues in the creation of the program. There is no way to account for all possible bugs in the program, but it is possible to prove the program is tangible.

Q: What does the sizeof operator return?
A: Returns the size of the array in bytes during the program compilation.

Q: In one sentence, what is the main idea implemented by insertion sort?
A: Insertion sort progresses through a list of elements and determines where the next element should be inserted into an already sorted array starting with sorting and using the first two elements.

Q: What are the two main functions defined by a queue?
A: enqueue dequeue

Q: What is a function signature?
A: the signature of a function includes the name of the function, the number and types of parameters, and the return type

Q: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
A: Only constants can be used to declare the size of automatic and static arrays Exists for the duration of the program Is initialized when its declaration is first encountered All elements are initialized to zero if not explicitly initialized

Q: What stages in the software life cycle are influenced by the testing stage?
A: Elaboration, construction, and transition.

Q: What is a tree?
A: A type of data structure in which each element is attached to one or more elements directly beneath it.

Q: What is the role of a prototype program in problem solving?
A: it provides a limited proof of concept to verify with the client before actually programming the whole application.

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: constructors cannot return values

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: If a function's arguments are large in size, computing time and memory space is not wasted copying down the argument and passing it to the function.  Also pass by reference gives the function called the permission to read edit the argument directly.

Q: What is a stack?
A: A stack is similar to an array, but does not allow for random access. Stacks only allow a user to retrieve the last item put into the stack. Last in, fist out.

Q: What are the elements typically included in a class definition?
A: Member functions and data members.

Q: What stages in the software life cycle are influenced by the testing stage?
A: Refining, Production, Maintenance

Q: What are the similarities between iteration and recursion?
A: based on a control statement, involve repetition, involve a termination test.

Q: Briefly describe the divide-and-conquer paradigm.
A: Divide-and-conquer refers to abstraction, the act of separating large, complex problems into smaller, easier problems that can be solved by a relatively simple algorithm.

Q: When does C++ create a default constructor?
A: C++ creates a default constructor during compilation if one is not provided.

Q: Briefly, how does selection sort work?
A: It starts at the first element and replaces it with the smallest element found to the right. It then repeats with the next element in the list.

Q: What are the main advantages associated with object-oriented programming?
A: the main advantages to object-oriented programming  is data abstraction, easier maintenance, and re-usability.

Q: How can you implement a stack with an array?
A: Use a pointer that always points to the end of the array list for push/pop modifications.

Q: What is a queue?
A: A data structure in C++ where the the first element in the queue is the first element taken out of the queue.

Q: What is the role of a header-file?
A: create a comon area to contain reusable functions.

Q: What are the access-specifiers that can be used in a C++ class definition?
A: Public and private specifiers.

Q: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function?
A: A data member is a more general term describing all objects instantiated within a member function.  "Local" in local variables refers more to the scope of a variable, which may be located in anything from a control structure to a class.  Local variables whose scope are in a member function are the same as data members of member functions.

Q: What does the address (&) operator return?
A: & returns the memory address of its operand.

Q: Briefly, how does selection sort work?
A: Selection sort is usually a recursive sorting method where you divide the elements to be sorted in half repeatedly. You then sort the smallest case, then work your way up, sorting each until they are all sorted.

Q: What is the number of operations for insertion sort under a best-case scenario, and what is the best-case scenario?
A: insertion sort will make zero operations (and length - 1 comparisons) in the best case scenario, that is, when the array its given is already in order.

Q: What is the main advantage of a doubly-linked list over a basic linked list?
A: A doubly linked list allows you to traverse the list in either direction. Each node points to its successor as well as to its predecessor.

Q: In one sentence, what is the main idea implemented by selection sort?
A: Search for the largest item in an array and swap it with the last unsorted item.

Q: When does C++ create a default constructor?
A: when there is not one already for a specific class

Q: Briefly describe in one sentence how does merge sort work?
A: merge sort breaks the array down in halves until it is comparing two values, sorts those two values, then merges that back with the other broken down parts that it sorted, each level merging more sets together till you return back to your whole array in order.

Q: How can you implement a stack with an array?
A: create an array and implement pointers that point to the next list item down and stack them up.

Q: How are objects initialized when they are created?
A: ie. GradeBook myGradeBook();  call upon the class and then give it a name like shown

Q: What is the height of a tree?
A: The intensity of the children. Say you begin with one node, Thats one height. Then you add two children to that node and then two children to each of those nodes and two children to each of THOSE nodes. Youre current height would be 4.

Q: What is the inorder traversal of a binary tree?
A: postorder

Q: What stages in the software life cycle are influenced by the testing stage?
A: Verification, coding, refining the solution and maintenance are all influenced by the testing stage.

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: all constructors are functions but not all functions are constructors. Also functions can have nearly infinite purposes, while constructors always create an instance of whichever class you are using. You can change how a constructor does something but not what it does. With functions you can change not only the how but also the what.

Q: What are the two main functions defined by a queue?
A: The two main functions are enqueue which inserts an item at the back of the queue and dequeue which removes an item from the front of the queue.

Q: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?
A: a prototype does not include any actual code where the function has all the code that is executed in the program.

Q: What is the main difference between a string of characters that is read into a variable of type string versus a variable of type char[]?
A: The character array has an end of line character at the end of it.

Q: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?
A: A function prototype tells the compiler the function name, return type and the number and type of parameters without revealing the implementations contained in the function definition.

Q: What is a linked list?
A: Consists of sequence of nodes, each containing a number of data fields and one or two links called pointers that point to the next or previous nodes.

Q: How can you implement a stack with a list?
A: use a linked list and keep track of a pointer that points to the first item

Q: What is the difference between an array that is declared as static and one that is not?
A: a static array will be called only once. once it has been declared the complier will ignore the static line if it comes to it again.

Q: What are the similarities between iteration and recursion?
A: they are both based on a control statement, both involve repetition, both involve a termination case, both graduatlly approach that termination case, and both can occur infinitely

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: variables that exist throught the entire script. their values can be changed anytime in the code and fucntions.

Q: What does the sizeof operator return?
A: total number of bytes in the array

Q: What are the main operations associated with a stack?
A: Push, Pop, isEmpty, isFull  Maybe List to show all elements or an operation to count how many elements in the stack.

Q: What is the difference between an array that is declared as static and one that is not?
A: Standard arrays terminate when the functions that call them finish. A static array is not removed from memory when it's parent function terminates, leaving it available for other functions (or new instances of the original function).

Q: What is the base case for a recursive implementation of merge sort?
A: array of length 1

Q: What is the main difference between a string of characters that is read into a variable of type string versus a variable of type char[]?
A: an array of characters has one more element, its last element,the terminating element, or null, which doesnt exist in a variable of type string

Q: How are arrays passed to functions?
A: you pass a pointer to the first item and also pass the size.

Q: What are the two main functions defined by a stack?
A: Push and pop.

Q: What does the address (&) operator return?
A: Returns the memory address of its operand.

Q: What are the access-specifiers that can be used in a C++ class definition?
A: Public, Private, Restricted

Q: What is the base case for a recursive implementation of merge sort?
A: The best case is the same as the worst case O(n log n) for a recursive merge sort.

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: A constructor is a method that starts new instances of a class. (Example: Employee employee1(parameters) starts a new instance of object of type Employee). A function is simply a module w/in a program that completes its single desired task.

Q: What is a binary search tree?
A: a binary tree where the children are ordered such that the right side is greater than the current node, and the left is less than or equal the current node.

Q: What stages in the software life cycle are influenced by the testing stage?
A: Elaboration, Construction, Transition

Q: What is a stack?
A: Stores a set of elements in a last in first out order.

Q: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function?
A: a local variable is only useable within the function it is defined, whereas a data member is available to any method within its class

Q: What is the difference between an array that is declared as static and one that is not?
A: static arrays cannot be changed while normal arrays can be changed

Q: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function?
A: Data members are declared inside the class, but outside of any member functions. Unlike with local variables, each object of the class keeps its own copy of the data members stored in memory.

Q: What is the height of a tree?
A: The connections between elements are called branches. Trees are often called inverted trees because they are normally drawn with the root at the top.

Q: How are arrays passed to functions?
A: by reference only

Q: What is typically included in a class definition?
A: Data members and Member functions

Q: Where do C++ programs begin to execute?
A: At the "main()" function

Q: What are the different ways to pass a pointer to a function?
A: By argument and reference.

Q: Briefly describe the divide-and-conquer paradigm.
A: Break up very large data structures into smaller sub-units, that are easier to manipulate.

Q: How many steps does it take to search a node in a binary search tree?
A: The number of steps to search a node is the function n-1.

Q: How does the compiler handle inline functions?
A: tells the compiler to make a copy of function's code in place to avoid a function call.  it typically ignores it, except for the smallest functions.

Q: How many dimensions need to be specified when passing a multi-dimensional array as an argument to a function?
A: not answered

Q: What are the elements typically included in a class definition?
A: Class is user defined.  It contains members, data and functions.  The keyword class is used and includes brackets ({})

Q: How can you implement a queue with a list?
A: Have a pointer to the last element in the list and then use enqueue to insert items there. Link the first and last elements together to dequeue the list.

Q: How are infix expressions evaluated by computers?
A: convert infix expressions to postfix expression and evaluate the postfix expression

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: Actual arguments are associated with dummy arguments when a function or subroutine is referenced. In a procedure reference, the actual argument list identifies the correspondence between the actual arguments provided in the list and the dummy arguments of the subprogram

Q: What is the advantage of linked lists over arrays?
A: The primary advantage of linked lists over arrays is their ability to become larger or smaller as data is added and removed from the list, whereas arrays may waste memory for small data sets, and run out of space for large data sets.

Q: In one sentence, what is the main idea implemented by selection sort?
A: It finds the minimum element in the array and swaps it with the first element then repeats this step swapping the minimum element with nth positions in the array.

Q: In one sentence, what is the main idea implemented by selection sort?
A: Selection sort finds the minimum value in the list, swaps it with the first value in the list, and repeats throughout the list.

Q: How many dimensions need to be specified when passing a multi-dimensional array as an argument to a function?
A: one

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: The original variable being referenced can be modified directly by the called function.

Q: What is a function signature?
A: its the scope, type, and parameters of that function that give it it's properties and defines it against other functions.

Q: What are the similarities between iteration and recursion?
A: Many problems can be solved by both iteration and recursion, and either may go into a condition of infinite execution if a termination test is omitted.

Q: Where are variables declared in a C++ program?
A: In the declaration of Functions, for statements, and while statements. in the body of If, For, while, do while, statements, in namespaces, headers, etc  ( almost anywhere. ) anywhere in the program, as long as it is on it's own line.

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: gives function ability to access and modify the caller's argument data directly

Q: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function?
A: data members are declared in a class definition but outside the bodies of a class's member-function definitions. Local variables are declared in a function definition's body

Q: What are the elements typically included in a class definition?
A: data members and function definitions

Q: What is the main advantage of a doubly-linked list over a basic linked list?
A: they can traverse in both directions

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: A constructor initializes values and a function usual performs some sort of operation.

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: A constructor is called whenever a new object of that class is made.

Q: How are linked lists passed as arguments to a function?
A: Pass-by-reference

Q: When does C++ create a default constructor?
A: When no parameters are set is when a default constructor is used.

Q: What is the main difference between strings declared using the type string versus strings declared using an array of characters?
A: the type string is a class and is safer, while the other is just an array of characters.

Q: What is a function signature?
A: the body of the function that holds all the actual code

Q: What is the Euler tour traversal of a tree?
A: Start from the root, circle around the _whole_ "tree", naming each node as you see it.

Q: Where do C++ programs begin to execute?
A: They begin to execute at the funcion main().

Q: What does the sizeof operator return?
A: Returns size of operand in bytes.

Q: What is the main advantage of arrays over linked lists?
A: Arrays are good for random access and good for sequential access which are both in constant time. Where linked lists are linear for random access. Arrays are faster in this case.

Q: How are linked lists passed as arguments to a function?
A: The linked list object contains the head, through which the other elements are accessible.

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: It is often more efficient to pass references, rather than large objects, to functions. This allows the compiler to pass the address of the object while maintaining the syntax that would have been used to access the object.

Q: How are objects initialized when they are created?
A: classname objectname(input parameters);

Q: What is the main advantage of linked lists over arrays?
A: Linked lists can grow and shrink as you need them to.  Arrays have a fixed size.

Q: Briefly describe the divide-and-conquer paradigm.
A: dividing and conquering means breaking a problem into two smaller problems, solving both of those, and putting the two solutions together.

Q: What is the main advantage of arrays over linked lists?
A: Array based implementation requires less memory than lined lists based implementation

Q: What does the star (*) operator return?
A: It dereferences a pointer, meaning it returns the value stored in the memory address a pointer refers to.

Q: How can you implement a stack with an array?
A: Allocate an array of some pre-defined size. Bottom stack element stored at element 0. The last index in the array is the top. Increment top when one element is pushed.

Q: In one sentence, what is the main idea implemented by insertion sort?
A: To sort the elements in an array by removing an element from the input data and inserting it at the correct position.

Q: What is the stack operation corresponding to the enqueue operation in queues?
A: push

Q: How are linked lists passed as arguments to a function?
A: By the head of the list. It takes the head address and traverses from there on in.

Q: What is the main difference between strings declared using the type string versus strings declared using an array of characters?
A: the array of characters has a set length, while the type string has virtually unlimited length.

Q: How can an array be addressed in pointer/offset notation?
A: using the star operator.   array: b[n] can be accessed by *(bpointer +n)

Q: What is a variable?
A: a placeholder to hold information used in the program... for example: int can hold: 1, 2, 3, 4, 68, 72, 256, etc. float can hold: 1.54, 55.55, 1.24, 5.657, 8.8123, et. char can hold: A, B, C, D, E, F, !, 4, 5, 6, P, etc.

Q: How many constructors can be created for a class?
A: infinite

Q: What are the elements typically included in a class definition?
A: data members, class variables, and functions

Q: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?
A: the Prototype creates a framework to call the function definition. While a function definition is where the function is actually programmed out and created into a final product.

Q: What is a function pointer?
A: A pointer to a function itself, contains the address of the function and can be used to call that function

Q: What is the main advantage of linked lists over arrays?
A: Unlike arrays, linked lists can insert and delete without shifting data and change in size easily.

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: Constructors don't have a return type.

Q: What is a function pointer?
A: It contains the address of the function in memory.

Q: What is a leaf?
A: the node with degree 0

Q: What is the alternative way to solve a problem that could be solved through recursive functions?
A: iteration

Q: How many steps does it take to search a node in a binary search tree?
A: to find a node in a binary search tree takes at most the same number of steps as there are levels of the tree.

Q: What is the number of operations for insertion sort under a best-case scenario, and what is the best-case scenario?
A: O(n)

Q: What are the two main functions defined by a queue?
A: enqueue - insert into queue dequeue - remove element

Q: What is the main difference between a while and a do...while statement?
A: The main difference between a do and a do...while statement is in a do...while statement is the statements in a do block are always executed atleast once.   The while statement will only execute if its condition is true.

Q: How are objects initialized when they are created?
A: Objects are usually initialized at the beginning of the program and are initialized usually in the main function. They are initialized after the class's name.

Q: What are the main advantages associated with object-oriented programming?
A: Coding and Debugging programs are usually easier, as either the compiler will specify the object that is working incorrectly, or the function an object was assigned to will be easier to identify.  The code itself also looks more organized and is easier to read and will help to avoid redundant coding.  Post-programming maintenance is also easier.  Also, modules can be reused several times in other programs without too much hassle.   Abstraction is the art of breaking down one big problem into smaller, simpler problems and solving them.  Many of the smaller problems are shared between unique complex problems, and creating modules to these solve these smaller repeated problems can save time when you encounter them again.

Q: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?
A: Compiler selects proper function to execute based on number, types and order of arguments in the function call.

Q: Briefly describe the divide-and-conquer paradigm.
A: It takes a large problem and splits it into two or more easier or faster solutions, and  makes for better readability.

Q: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?
A: Overloaded functions are distinguished by their signatures, Name mangling or name decoration, and type-safe linkage ensures that proper overloaded functions is called and types of the arguments conform to tpes to the parameters.

Q: How many constructors can be created for a class?
A: It depends on the number of objects. Each object should have a constructor.

Q: How many comparisons does it take to find an element in a binary search tree?
A: In a binary search tree of size 'n' it takes log(n) comparisons to find a specified element.

Q: What is a pointer?
A: A pointer is a variable that contains the memory address of a variable that has a value.

Q: Briefly describe in one sentence how does merge sort work?
A: Mergesort divides the array into smaller halves and then combines the sorted subarrays into one sorted array.

Q: Briefly describe in one sentence how does merge sort work?
A: the merge sort continually divides the array (or set of containers) into halves, until it reaches the point where there is just one element left, then merges each of the sets of two sorted arrays (containers).

Q: What is the experimental approach for measuring the running time of an algorithm?
A: running the input with various inputs measuring the running time with  system time

Q: What is the role of a prototype program in problem solving?
A: Simulating the behavior of only a portion of the desired software product.

Q: What is the role of a header-file?
A: To hold reusable content or modules separate from the actual  source-code file that can be easily referenced and employed for different programs.

Q: What is the stack operation corresponding to the enqueue operation in queues?
A: push

Q: How does the compiler handle inline functions?
A: it treats them as the same function

Q: What is the Euler tour traversal of a tree?
A: traversing a tree level by level

Q: What is the main difference between a while and a do...while statement?
A: While loop evaluates its expression at the top of its loop and decides if it needs to execute, and the do-while always executes at least once and then evaluates its expression at the bottom of its loop.

Q: What is the main difference between strings declared using the type string versus strings declared using an array of characters?
A: the type string uses less storage and you have to change the string all at once. with an array of characters you can make permutations of words using the characters stored in the array, without needing to actually access and change the variables. with an array of characters you can just change how they're accessed.

Q: What is the Euler tour traversal of a tree?
A: The Euler tour traversal of a tree begins at the root and visits each node in the tree from the left, then bottom, then right sides.

Q: What is a queue?
A: A quese is an list that stores a set of elements in a particular order. It has Stack principle, but in this case, its "First In, First Out". The first element inserted is the first element to be removed.

Q: What is the role of a header-file?
A: to declare the functions being used in the classes

Q: What does the sizeof operator return?
A: the total number of bytes of an object.

Q: What is a stack?
A: a data type that stores a set of elements in a certain order, last in, first out.

Q: What is a binary tree?
A: A set of zero or more nodes, partitioned into a root node and two possibly empty sets that are binary trees. Thus, each node in a binary tree has at most two children, the left child and the right child.

Q: How many dimensions need to be specified when passing a multi-dimensional array as an argument to a function?
A: When passing a multi-dimensional array, all dimensions must be specified except for the first dimension.

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: Functions can directly modify arguments that are passed by reference.

Q: What stages in the software life cycle are influenced by the testing stage?
A: Refining and Coding

Q: What is the difference between a circular linked list and a basic linked list?
A: No node in a circular linked list contains NULL.

Q: How can you implement a queue with a list?
A: By creating and adding nodes at the end of the list and removing the nodes from the beginning of the list.

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: The entire program

Q: Where do C++ programs begin to execute?
A: In the main() function.

Q: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
A: a constructor cannot return values, its not even void. it is used to initialize an object's data when it is created. whereas, a function is created to do a specific task, and it can return values.

Q: What is the main difference between a string of characters that is read into a variable of type string versus a variable of type char[]?
A: the one that is type string has an extra string member. The /0 at the end.

Q: What is the number of operations for insertion sort under a best-case scenario, and what is the best-case scenario?
A: n operations, where n is the number of items.

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: because you can't change the original and passing by reference limits memory needed for the program.

Q: How are arrays passed to functions?
A: Usually the same way you pass anything else... you do not have to specify the length of a char array, just pass it to the function by sending the name of the array.  Example: char str[20]; isPalindrome(str); // this sends the char array to the function isPalindrome.  Otherwise, would need to send the length of the array as well.

Q: What does the star (*) operator return?
A: The * returns the value

Q: What is a queue?
A: A queue is an abstract data structure in which operations are performed at both ends giving the queue first in first out behavior.

Q: What is the alternative way to solve a problem that could be solved through recursive functions?
A: Another alternative way to solve a problem instead of using recursive functions is by using iteration.

Q: What is a binary search tree?
A: A binary tree where the value in any node n is greater than the value in every node in n's left subtree, but less than the value of every node in n's right subtree.

Q: What is the main disadvantage of a doubly-linked list over a basic linked list?
A: Need more memory to store "previous" pointers.

Q: How are objects initialized when they are created?
A: Objects are initialized essentially as copies of the corresponding classes, complete with their own separate variables.

Q: How many constructors can be created for a class?
A: As many as are needed, depending on how many variables one wishes to directly modify or leave as default when instantiating an object.

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: File scope.

Q: Briefly, how does selection sort work?
A: selection sort searches for the smallest element of the remaining data organization and places it at the largest point of the new data organization

Q: What does a function signature include?
A: The name of the function and the types of its arguments.

Q: What is a function pointer?
A: it is a pointer that points to the address of a function.

Q: What is the main advantage of arrays over linked lists?
A: You can access specific elements quickly in an array.  In a linked list you must traverse the list to get access the same element.

Q: What is the role of a header-file?
A: the role of a header file list all the functions a class can do while hiding the inner workings of its functions

Q: In one sentence, what is the main idea implemented by selection sort?
A: find the minimum value in the list swap it with the first element in the list the find the second largest and swap it with the second element in the array continue like this until  the array is sorted.

Q: What is the alternative way to solve a problem that could be solved through recursive functions?
A: Iteration. A while loop or a for loop will be able to accomplish the same desired outcome... It may be faster than recursion, but could also be harder to understand.

Q: What are the two different ways of specifying the length of an array?
A: statically and dynamically

Q: What are the elements typically included in a class definition?
A: class variables, class function prototypes

Q: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference?
A: Overall the program has better performance (means it is faster) because it does not have to copy large amounts of data.

Q: How are arrays passed to functions?
A: Arrays are passed by reference.

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: File scope

Q: What operations would you need to perform to find a given element on a stack?
A: either traverse the entire list and pop the given part or create a pointer system that automatically points to it.

Q: How can you implement a stack with an array?
A: You keep track of the last item entered into the array and do not  allow the user access to the other parts of the array.

Q: What is a pointer?
A: A data type that stores the memory address of another variable.

Q: What is a stack?
A: Stores a set of elements in a particular order.

Q: How are linked lists passed as arguments to a function?
A: A function with access to a linked list's head pointer has access to the entire list. Pass the head pointer to a function as a reference argument

Q: What is the role of a header-file?
A: header files contain code which can be used in multiple files

Q: What is a function pointer?
A: is a pointer that contains the address of a function

Q: What are the two main functions defined by a queue?
A: enqueue and dequeue

Q: What is the base case for a recursive implementation of merge sort?
A: there is one object in the split array to sort.

Q: How many steps does it take to search a node in a binary search tree?
A: it takes at most h steps, where h is the height of the tree.

Q: Where do C++ programs begin to execute?
A: at the main function  int main() {}

Q: What is a queue?
A: a list of objects that follow the rule first in first out, essentially a linked list that goes in order of the first object in the list is the first to be taken off.

Q: What is a function signature?
A: The function signature tells what the function parameters and includes all the function calls

Q: What are the two different ways of specifying the length of an array?
A: manually inside the brackets or automatically via an initializer list

Q: What are the two main functions defined by a queue?
A: enqueue and dequeue

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: Any functions that follows their deceleration that  are in the source code file are allowed to have access the variables.  Also global scope variables retrain their value throughout the execution of the program.

Q: What is the height of a tree?
A: The number of nodes on the longest path from the root to the leaf.

Q: What is the main difference between a string of characters that is read into a variable of type string versus a variable of type char[]?
A: char array needs an end character signature and is made up of characters each separate from each other, a string is an object in itself, with a value that the user enters.

Q: What is the main disadvantage of a doubly-linked list over a basic linked list?
A: There are more pointers to set, the mechanics of inserting into and deleting from a doubly linked list are a bit more involved than for a singly linked list.

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: Global Variables can be used in any function as long as the appropriate .h file that holds the variable is included

Q: How are infix expressions evaluated by computers?
A: they are converted to postfix

Q: When defining a recursive function, what are possible causes for infinite recursion?
A: Infinite recursion may occur if no base case is defined or if the call is not varied.

Q: What is the scope of global variables?
A: can be referenced by any function that follows their declarations or definitions in the source file

Q: How can you implement a stack with an array?
A: Create an array, size N.  N++ when one element is pushed.  N-- when one element is popped.

Q: What is a variable?
A: A variable is a value that is subject to change in a computer's memory that can be used by programs.  Programs can change the value of the variable and recall it later or act on it directly.

Q: What is a stack?
A: is a list of element where the first one to be removed is the last one inserted

Q: What is the main difference between a while and a do...while statement?
A: A while loop terminates at the beginning of the loop, a do/while terminates at the end of the loop.

Q: How can you implement a queue with a list?
A: Implement the operation dequeue() as the list operation remove(1) and the operation getFront(queueFront) as the list operation retrieve(1, queueFront)

Q: What does the sizeof operator return?
A: sizeof returns the size of the operand in bytes

Q: How are arrays passed to functions?
A: function( int [], int length)

Q: How can you implement a queue with an array?
A: To use and array to implement a Queue, element or item 0, should be the top element in the array. Every time an element is inserted, all the items in the array are pushed back one space. The top element is always removed first.

Q: What is the experimental approach for measuring the running time of an algorithm?
A: not answered

Q: What is the main difference between a while and a do...while statement?
A: A do...while loop will always execute atleast once, a while loop may never   execute depending on teh conditions.

Q: What is typically included in a class definition?
A: public section and private section, and there must be a semicolon to set the end

Q: How many dimensions need to be specified when passing a multi-dimensional array as an argument to a function?
A: All dimensions except for the first one need to be specified when passing an array to a function, the compiler needs to know how many memory addresses to skip to make it back to the 2nd element in the first dimension.  The size of the first dimension does not need to be specified.

Q: What is the experimental approach for measuring the running time of an algorithm?
A: In experimental terms, the running time of an algorithm is measured by the number of operations required to complete the function. This number can usually be expressed in big-O notation.

Q: What does a function signature include?
A: A function signature includes a function's return type, parameters and semi-colon.

Q: What is the main advantage of linked lists over arrays?
A: linked lists are abe to grow as needed to a new size
